name: Main Office
description: Is a contract brewery operation at present.    Leveraged off of the previous operation of Connecticut's first brewpub, The Hartford Brewery Ltd.    Some of the recipes from the previous operation are showcased in our current portfolio.  Others are new recipes created by our former brewing team.    Our beers are currently being brewed at Shipyard Brewery in Portland Maine, using our explicit recipe design and oversight.    Our mission is to continually improve sales of our brands to facilitate the growth of additional brands and with a future in mind that may lead to a new brewery in the region to support our brand lines.

name: Harviestoun Brewery
description: The brewery was founded in 1984 by Ken Brooker on a farm just outside Dollar in Central Scotland. Due to the growing success and demand for Harviestoun Ales, the brewery moved to a new purpose built 60 barrel plant, 5 miles away in Alva, in 2004. Alva was chosen as the location as this allowed us to carry on using the outstanding soft water from the Ochil Hills.    Harviestoun Brewery was later bought by Caledonian Brewery in 2006. However, in the wake of the acquisition of Caledonian brewing Company by Scottish & Newcastle UK, the brewery became independent once again in 2008 by three noble shareholders who sought to preserve the status as an independent award-winning micro-brewery.     Currently, Harviestoun is going through some new and exciting changes to expand the brewery. We are working hard to increase production, while insuring that we still outputting nothing but quality beer. Please look forward to keeping up to date with us on our progress and exciting new changes to our product range.

name: Hausbrauerei Altstadthof
description: At our historic brewery location in Nuremberg's old city, you can experience traditional beer brewing first-hand. Here is the place where especially the classic beer of the city – the Red Beer – has returned to its home.    It is the skilled manufacturing that makes the difference for our graduate master brewer Reinhard Engel. For this, the “Hausbrauerei Altstadthof” still brews with traditional copper kettles, wooden fermenting vats, and plain old-school equipment. As a matter of course, only natural hops are used during the organic production.    All fresh beers are filled by hand into traditional 1-litre swing bottles and can be bought in the brewery shop and in the brewery tavern as well as at our online shop.

name: Haven Gastropub
description: Haven Brewing produces small-batch, house-crafted beers in Pasadena, CA. This is the first foray into micro-production from haven collective.    “It’s really a great feeling to take water, grains, and hops, and make it into something amazing that people will love,” said Haven Brewmaster David Larsen. “We are very proud of our small-batch, house-crafted beers produced in Pasadena."

name: Haverhill Brewery
description: Founded in 2003 as the TAP brewpub in downtown Haverhill Massachusetts, the Haverhill Brewery has quickly been increasing its local distribution to Bars and Liquor stores throughout the Massachusetts and Northern Rhode Island Area.    Since opening our Restaurant/Brew Pub The TAP in 2003, we Have been providing Massachusetts with award winning hand-crafted ales and lagers. In late 2005 we began to branch out and distribute our beers throughout eastern Massachusetts. Currently our beer is available throughout the state as well as northern Rhode Island

name: Haw River Farmhouse Ales
description: Haw River Farmhouse Ales will handcraft traditional French- & Belgian-style ales with a little southern flair, using local and organic ingredients where possible in each of our beers. Located in Saxapahaw, NC, opening Memorial Day Weekend, 2012.

name: Hawai'i Nui Brewing
description: At Hawai‘i Nui Brewing, we’re passionate about craft beer. We brew small batches of our all-natural ales and lagers from the finest barley malt, wheat, hops and yeast.  We are committed to local production in Hawai‘i.      Our uniquely well balanced Island Style beer is perfect for your time in Paradise!    What is Island Style? To those of us who call Hawai’i home, it’s all about balance. Working hard, sure. But when pau hana time comes, it’s about friends and family. Heeding the call of the sun and sand, surf and sea. Tasting freshness. Celebrating music. Stopping at sunset. Resting easy at night. Appreciating life’s detours–what we call holo holo time. Living life as it should be.

name: Hawcreek Brewing Company
description: We strive to make delicious, fresh, hand-crafted beer and refuse to produce anything less. we are looking forward to becoming your brew of choice when we open late this fall.

name: Hawks Brewing
description: (No longer brewing)

name: Hawthorn Brewing Co
description: In the days of old, travelling merchants criss-crossed the globe, journeying to exotic lands in search of the finest treasures. Following in this bold tradition are the Flavour Merchants of the Hawthorn Brewing Co. From their base in Hawthorn, these intrepid explorers scour the beer world, risking life and limb to bring home the secrets of its best brewers. It is only by trialling and refining these techniques that we are able to create award winning beers of distinction including our Premium Pale Ale, Amber Ale, Pilsner and Witbier.  Yes.. It’s a tough job, but someone has to do it.

name: Haymarket Pub & Brewery
description: Specializing in classic Belgian and contemporary American beer styles, Pete will be producing an array of brews for every beer palette. Crowley, a highly decorated brewer has won over 50 local, national and international awards for his brewing creations including medals from the World Beer Cup, Great American Beer Festival and Festival of Wood and Barrel Aged Beer. Varieties will range from refreshing Pilsners to hoppy ales to rich Imperial Stouts aged in whiskey barrels in our own cellar, a brewing technique that has put Crowley on the national beer map for his pioneering work with the specialty. Our impressive array of 32 tap handles behind the bar will feature more than 10 house brewed varieties with space to offer other craft beer selections.

name: Headlands Brewing Company
description: Headlands Brewing Co. was founded by people that play outside.  We have a sense of adventure and embody the spirit of the place that we live, celebrating the bay, the history, the trails and the mountains that surround us. Outside the brewery you can find us surfing and swimming in the beautiful waters in our backyard or cycling or running through the valleys, parks, hills and mountains surrounding our bay.     Patrick Horn (formerly of Pacific Brewing Laboratory) and Phil Cutti (Southpaw BBQ) create classic beers along with seasonal and experimental brews that push the envelope.

name: HeadStrong Brewery
description: Welcome to Douglas, Wyoming and the upstart of HeadStrong Brewery. Over the last couple years, we have been gradually developing a plan and product to bring to our community.  Craft Beers!      Our promise to our customers is that we will not compromise on the quality and ingredients we put into every batch of beer we brew.    Our selection of materials will emphasize the Wyoming and Douglas experience while bringing ingredients from around the world to our customers.  Each of our craft beers will be highlighted and served in it's own special glass that will enhance the look, feel and flavor of the brewed product.

name: Healdsburg Beer Co
description: Founded in 2007, Healdsburg Beer Company is an independent and family owned brewery. We produce limited quantities of artisan cask ales using only the finest ingredients in laboriously attended to small lots. Seriously.   Annual production for the brewery is less than 1,000 gallons and we sweat the details on each pint. Our brewing philosophy is grounded in the idea of balance. We strive to create beer that balances the flavors that we find in the malt, hops and yeast and create a layered, nuanced and flavorful beer that is still an easy drinking and friendly pint.   Living in Sonoma County, it is difficult to think of any beverage without also thinking of food. Sonoma has an incredible food culture that includes some of the world’s finest artisan purveyors and restaurants. All of Healdsburg Beer Company’s beers are purposefully crafted to be friendly and complementary to a broad range of food.

name: Heartland Brewery
description: Founded in 1995, Heartland Brewery is a NYC-based restaurant group with 7 locations, all with their own distinct identities. What they share in common is our award-winning locally brewed beer and a commitment to great food and warm, friendly service.

name: Heater Allen Brewery
description: We are a small artisan brewery located in McMinnville, Oregon.  We specialize in producing distinctive all-malt lager and other German and Czech style beers.  We use only the finest, most appropriate malts, hops, water and yeast in our beers.  While our lagers are similar to those made in Germany, they are our own unique interpretation of the style.     Lager beers are fermented at lower temperatures than ale, using yeast that has adapted to cooler fermentations.  Low temperature fermentations create fewer “yeasty” aromas, esters, and flavors that are so common in ales.  We brew lagers because we enjoy their smooth malty and hoppy character.
hoursOfOperation: If you'd like to stop by the Brewery, either come by on a brew day, usually Tuesdays and Fridays (check the calendar for a complete list of brew days) or call us during the week (we rarely check messages on the weekend) to schedule an appointment.

name: Heathen Brewing

We currently do not serve any food but you are welcome to bring in any that you like, order delivery, or better yet place an order to go at any of the great restaurants that Dogtown has to offer! name: Heavy Seas Beer
description: Heavy Seas Beer is brewed by Clipper City Brewing Company, in Baltimore, Maryland. The brewery was established by Hugh Sisson in 1995. Previously, Sisson operated Maryland's first brewpub, Sisson's. The brewery is named for the famed Clipper ship - first developed and built in the home port of Baltimore. While the name of the company remains Clipper City Brewing Company, all of its beer falls under the Heavy Seas brand. Heavy Seas is located at 4615 Hollins Ferry Road, Suite B, in the Halethorpe section of Baltimore. Heavy Seas currently offers a variety of beer styles in approx. 18 states within the United States.    Heavy Seas mission is to bring back the local brewery, and to do it in such a way that we are more than just a fringe player, but a positive part of our area. To accomplish this mission we have created a broad portfolio of products with enough diversity that we have at least one beer that can appeal to everyone. Whether your preference is for a classic American style lager beer, or a big, challenging Hop Cubed Ale, we have a something that will suit your taste. We believe in bringing beer drinkers the quality and flavor of a handcrafted beer while supporting the local communities we serve.

name: Hedge House
description: The Hedge House is truly a community gathering place located in the heart of the Division/Clinton Street Neighborhood.    Since opening in December 2003, the Hedge House has been a place for families and friends to gather over a pint of great Lompoc beer and a meal of hearty pub grub.    Our menu features great sandwiches, salads, and appetizers. We feature six regular taps of Lompoc beer, along with our seasonals.    We’re known for our huge patio and deck outside the 1912 craftsman-style bungalow. On sunny days it seems the entire neighborhood comes down to enjoy the evening.    Kids and dogs are welcome.

name: Heineken
description: Heineken Lager Beer was first brewed by Gerard Adriaan Heineken in 1873. The beer is made of purified water, malted barley, hops, and yeast. In 1886 H. Elion finished the development of the Heineken A-yeast, which is still used in the brewing process today

name: Heinzelmännchen Brewery
description: In a microbrewery in downtown Sylva, NC, German-born brewmaster Dieter Kuhn and his wife Sheryl Rudd are creating light and refreshing German beer made with wholesome grains, fresh hops & no preservatives. All beers are keg conditioned and non-filtered, making them smooth and lighter in body.  Enjoy pints or flights in our taproom then take home your favorite in one of our unique, German 2-liter growlers. We have snacks available and you are welcome to bring in food from local restaurants (some will deliver) or your picnic!

name: Heist Brewery
description: It’s going down right now. There’s a Heist happening in Charlotte. Except at this robbery everybody’s going to get their share of the loot, er…brew. After over two years of planning, Charlotte will now be called home to the Heist Brewery.

name: Hell Bay Brewing Co
description: Hell Bay Brewing Company offers a high quality local beer that is sure to satisfy anyone looking for locally made products. Our beer is made from premium malts, hops, and yeast, handcrafted in small batches to ensure freshness.    Try some today. You will love it.

name: Hellbender Brewing Company
description: Hellbender Brewing Company was created out of a true love for the art, culture, history, and science of craft brewing.  Just taste the beer we produce, and you will see the difference.  We have created every recipe as an artistic interpretation of an existing style, and refined it with years of tasting and fine tuning.      All of our flagship beer ingredients come from American brewing supply companies that source ingredients from the American midwest and northeast.  The majority of the hops that we use are grown in Oregon and Washington State, but some of our specialty beers will be brewed with hops from our very own farm in upstate New York.

name: Helltown Brewing
description: Helltown Brewing is a craft brewery located in Mount Pleasant, Pennsylvania- a small town situated in the the foothills of the Laurel Highlands.  The brewery, named in homage to our home town, will be brewing a variety of exceptional beer from IPAs to the traditional lambic styles

name: Helm's Brewing Co.
description: Helm's Brewing Co. is a community brewery. It's a place where people stop by after work to check out what's new on the menu and have a quick taster before heading home. Our facility is a place to take the edge off while enjoying a fine beer with neighbors and friends. Helm's Brewing Co. is a place where everyone is welcomed.

name: HenHouse Brewing Company
description: Founded in 2011, we crank out awesome beers 2 barrels at a time in uncompromising and fearless pursuit of our goal: creating new and interesting kinds of delicious. HenHouse is the work of our hands, hearts and brains and we hope you enjoy the beer as much as we enjoy making it.     We love beer, people, and Petaluma.

name: Henneberg Brewing Co.
description: We are a real Farm Brewery. We grow hops, we also grow and malt our own barley. Stop by our tasting room for samples of our great beers!

name: Henniker Brewing Company
description: Henniker Brewing Company was founded in 2011 in scenic Henniker, New Hampshire. We brew beer with real New Hampshire spirit of independence, home-town pride, and hard work. Our goal is pretty simple: to bring people together, to celebrate this quirky little town we live in, and to make a living doing something we care about. And, darn it, we think we do that pretty well. Using only the finest ingredients, we craft all of our beers by hand and stake our reputation on every glass it goes into. We wouldn't have it any other way. So go ahead, pour yourself a glass! We promise you'll be coming back for more. Cheers!

name: Henry Weinhard
description: Henry Weinhard's Private Reserve and Blitz-Weinhard are brands of beer first brewed in 1856 in Portland, Oregon, United States. The brewery was owned by the brewer Henry Weinhard of the Weinhard family, who also made a line of soft drinks which survives to this day.    The Blitz-Weinhard brand was among several regional Pacific Northwest beers which were staples in the Northwest market during the decades following the repeal of Prohibition until they began losing market share to the national brands in the 1960s and 1970s.

name: Herbert B. Friendly Brewing
description: Uniquely Northwest, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing delivers delicious, cold, refreshing beer made by hand with natural ingredients. Each batch is created from scratch for your enjoyment. Quality brews of different styles ranging from the classic to the unconventional. We celebrate our love affair with beer and hope to share it with you. Herbert B. Friendly. Small town beer, made Friendly!    Started in 2010 as a brew club between two friends, Herbert B. Friendly Brewing went nano in August on 2012 and opened its doors for business in January of 2013. We’re a small family business looking to express ourselves creatively though beer and share it with our local community.

name: Hereford & Hops Restaurant and Brewpub
description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.

name: Heretic Brewing Company
description: Be a Heretic. Don't drink ordinary beer. Embrace your inner heretic and join us to push the boundaries of beer flavors. We are crazy about beer and passionate about making it. Wanna be a heretic too? There’s always room for one more.

name: Heritage Brewing
description: Founded in 2013, Heritage Brewing Co. is a 20-barrel brewery set in the heart of Manassas, Virginia. Heritage Brewing is excited to bring great fresh and unique craft beer to our fellow Americans. From our 20-barrel brew house and oak aging program, to our 1/2 barrel artisan batches, we look to only produce the finest beer. We can't wait to share our passion for great beer with America.

name: Hermitage Brewing Company
description: Hermitage Brewing Company (HBC) is a Silicon Valley native.  In the few years HBC has been distributing, we have won multiple awards and accolades for our beer, including Hoptopia, Maltopia, Ale of the Imp, Ale of the 2 Tun, and our Single Hop Series.

name: Herslev Bryghus
description: Herslev Brewery is a microbrewery located on a farm with its own farm in the village Herslev near Roskilde Fjord.     We produce hand-brewed beer without computer automation. We use instead the eyes, nose and palate, and follows the beer from day to day. The key words of our production is quality, pure ingredients and full traceability.     We make beer, we can enjoy, and let the seasonal time inspire us in the development of new, intense flavors.

name: Hess Brewing
description: Hess Brewing has the distinction of being San Diego’s first licensed nano-brewery. Nano, as in small, not Nanu, Mork’s signoff. We truly brew in small hand-crafted batches, one point six barrels at a time (that’s just 50 gallons each batch). Stop by our tasting room and taste it for yourselves. Great Beer. No Exceptions. No Excuses.

name: Hi-Wire Brewing
description: At Hi-Wire, we really want to embrace our craft and be as independent and authentic as possible, while also managing to maintain an approachability to our product, as we feature highly drinkable, hand-crafted brews.    We’re fortunate to be able to be a part of one of the Craft Capitals of the country. Located in Asheville's "Brewery District", Hi-Wire's brewery and tasting room are within walking distance of six other local breweries in a few block radius. Come visit us in June, 2013.

name: Hideout Brewing Company
description: Originally opened in early 2005, the company was named for both the location and for the feel of pre-prohibition era local brewery. Taken over in early 2012 by new owners Scott Colson and Nick and Theresa Humphrey, the Hideout’s footprint has grown quite extensively. Now distributing to much of the southern half of the Lower Peninsula, they are adding new regions regularly. Coming soon will be bottled beer!    In the taproom, the selection recently increased to 25 taps directly behind the J shaped bar. The upper loft has darts, shuffle board and three big screen TVs. Behind the building you will find a Beer Garden including horseshoe pits and ample seating.    Menu beers available year round are Promiscuous Pilsner, Tommy Gun Red, Gangster IPA, and Smuggler’s Hazelnut Stout. Other offerings vary throughout the year including Wine, Seasonal and Specialty Beers, Hard Cider, and Mead.

name: High & Mighty Beer Company
description: High & Mighty Beer Company began in 2006 as an offshoot of Shelton Brothers beer importing company. Will Shelton took his idea for a novel German-style ale to Paper City Brewery in Holyoke, Massachusetts, and Beer of the Gods was born, to extraordinary commercial success, critical acclaim, and unabashed adoration from beer geeks the world over.    Eventually, Will discovered that he enjoyed selling the beer he made even more than he did the splendid beers that Shelton Brothers imports, and in June 2008, he abandoned his brother to focus on making American beer that added an American attitude to the best of European beer styles. The beer is still lovingly made at Paper City, but look for High & Mighty to open a brewery of its own in 2010.

name: High Desert Brewing Co.
description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.
hoursOfOperation: Mon - Sat:  11am - Midnight  Sun:  Noon - 10pm

name: High Falls Brewing Company
description: High Falls Brewing Company, located in Rochester, New York, is the fifth largest brewing company in America, and the brewers of JW Dundee's Honey Brown Lager, Michael Shea's Irish Amber, Genny Light, the Genesee Family of brands and Koch's Golden Anniversary. High Falls distributes its fine products across 41 states and Ontario, Canada.    High Falls also brews beer for other beer companies, such as the Boston Brewing Company (makers of Sam Adams beer). As much as 50% of the output of High Falls' brewery is for other firms. High Falls also distributes beer for other companies, some as far away as New Zealand, which may explain why trucks bearing the brands of other breweries (such as Coors) are sometimes seen on their premises.

name: High Hops Brewery
description: Here at High Hops we brew with the very Hops we grow in our fields. We do not limit ourselves to one style of beer. We like to brew all types of beers for all types of people. Enjoy this magical beverage comprised of Hops, Barley, water and yeast. Cheers!!    We are here to make excellent beer, to push the brewing limits ,and to exceed your taste buds expectations.

name: High Noon Saloon & Brewery
description: During the late 1800’s our building housed the Great Western Manufacturing Company which produced cast iron stoves for pioneers heading west. Today, the High Noon Saloon & Brewery is a Leavenworth landmark, serving honest food, fresh made beer, quality entertainment and a whole lot of FUN!    We have a lot going on! We’re a big, family-friendly restaurant featuring Steaks, Burgers, Sandwiches, Entrée Salads, BBQ, Wild Salmon (flown in FRESH not frozen), Buffalo Burgers (locally raised, hormone & anti-biotic free) and so much more. We also feature daily Lunch, Dinner and Drink Specials!    We are also Leavenworth’s hometown brewery, serving fresh made, award-winning hand-crafted beer from our on-site copper clad brewery. Our silver medal-winning Annie’s Amber Ale is available throughout Kansas in 6-pack 12oz. cans! The Kansas Department of Commerce has recently awarded High Noon & Annie’s Amber Ale the “Simply Kansas” label as a quality product made exclusively in Kansas!

name: High Point Wheat Beer Company
description: High Point Brewing Company was founded in 1996 as the first exclusive wheat beer brewery in America. The founder and driving force of High Point is award-winning homebrewer, Greg Zaccardi. After working as a brewer in southern Germany, Greg returned to the US to open his brewery.    Ramstein beers are made with the same care and precision that Greg learned in Germany. In fact, the wheat, barley, hops and yeast used to make Ramstein Beers are all imported directly from Bavaria.    Greg found a special brewer’s yeast used only by a small brewery in Bavaria. He was able to get the brewery to let him use the special yeast exclusively at High Point. The unique, complex character of Ramstein beers is a result of this private yeast and of course, High Point’s careful and proper brewing methods.    The name Ramstein was adopted from a town in Germany with a large American population. The town surrounds the U.S. Ramstein Air Force Base. High Point wanted the name of its beers to reflect a marriage of German tradition and American innovation.    Today High Point Brewing Company expanded beyond wheat beers and brews 11 different wheat beers and lagers.

We have a kids menu with lots of goodies and hand crafted Root Beer and Orange Cream Soda.Get Brewed!

name: High Water Brewing
description: Leveraging his successful 15 year brewing career, Brewmaster Steve Altimari has partnered with John Anthony, another seasoned veteran of the craft brewing industry, to start their own California Bay Area venture, High Water Brewing.    Inspired by the most creative brewing practices and styles across the world, Steve and John's love of beer and unbridled passion for all things flavorful have led to a line of products that represent the very best of the best. Together they have combined their visions of creating unique, flavorful beers and distributing them to as many people as possible.    Partnering with award-winning Drake's Brewing Company, Steve will craft High Water beers at Drake's Brewhouse in San Leandro, CA; fermentation will occur in High Water tanks at that same location.

name: Highland Brewing Company
description: Highland Brewing Company began in the basement of Barley's Taproom in downtown Asheville, North Carolina in 1994. Through the years the company has grown from a three person operation to a staff of almost 50, from about 4,000 to 35,000 square feet, and from a capacity to brew 2,000 barrels annually to almost 40,000. Those of you who saw the old brewery may remember the retrofitted dairy equipment we used. We held on to two of those tanks in our move to the East Asheville location. Alongside them, we have new fermentation and brite beer tanks to go with our 50-barrel brew house. Our pilot brew house is a brewer's playground for developing new seasonal beers, high gravity brews, and whatever else the brewers dream up. Highland currently supplies both Carolinas, Georgia, Tennessee, Florida, Alabama, Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia. Thanks for your support!

name: Highlander Brew Co
description: Highlander Brew Co. is located in South River, in the Almaguin Highlands of Ontario. The brewery is on the Northern edge of Algonquin Park, making Highlander the most northerly craft brewery in Ontario.

name: Highlands Hollow Brewhouse
description: Highlands Hollow is located on the road to Bogus Basin and is a favorite place to meet for skiers, cyclists and hikers alike. Just what you would expect from a brewpub, Highlands Hollow Brewhouse serves up great comfort food, and their handcrafted ales are some of the finest in the Northwest. The “Hollow” offers Happy Hour everyday from 3pm-6pm, daily lunch and dinner specials, along with live music by local artists on special occasions. Open 7 days a week with deck seating during the warmer months.

name: Highway 1 Brewing Company
description: A unique brewpub located on California's beautiful Highway 1, with ocean views from the bar and dinning room. Specializing in local ingredients and unusual combinations, in a relaxed coastal atmosphere.

name: Hofbräuhaus München
description: The Hofbräuhaus am Platzl, Munich's famous “hofbrauhaus” was founded in 1589 by the Duke of Bavaria, Wilhelm V. It is one of Munich's oldest beer halls. It was originally founded as the brewery to the old Royal Residence, which at that time was situated just around the corner from where the beer hall stands today. The beer quickly became world famous thanks to the first brewer, Heimeran Pongratz, and the famous "Bavarian Beer Purity Law" of 1516 that stated that only natural ingredients could be used in the brewing process. In fact, the beer became so famous that it once saved the city from annihilation. When King Gustavus Adolphus of Sweden invaded Bavaria during the Thirty Years' War in 1632, he threatened to sack and burn the entire city of Munich. He agreed to leave the city in peace if the citizens surrendered some hostages, and 600,000 barrels of Hofbräuhaus beer.

name: Innis & Gunn
description: Innis & Gunn is a specialist independent brewing company based in Edinburgh, Scotland. Established in 2003, its beer has gone on to be the most popular British bottled beer sold in Canada, and second most popular in Sweden. It was part of the nominated drinks list for the G8 Summit 2005 at Gleneagles Hotel.    The business is, since 2008, family owned following a management buy-out from its original part-owners, William Grant and Sons.    Their Innis & Gunn Original beer is brewed in Dunbar, East Lothian before being matured in American white oak Bourbon barrels for 30 days and is then a further 47 days in a marrying tun, and so it is matured for 77 days in total. It is 6.6% alcohol by volume. At first only available as a bottled beer it is now marketed both in bottles and as draught.    According to Innis and Gunn's website, the process was discovered in an ironic accident: the intent was to create a scotch whisky with ale flavours. To do this, a special beer was created which would then be stored in the whisky barrels. After the beer had conditioned the barrels, it was to be discarded and replaced with the whisky. The brewers noted that the process had an agreeable effect on the beer, and thus aging the beer became an end in itself.    A "blonde" version of Innis & Gunn is also widely available, and a limited edition matured in rum barrels was produced.

description: The Iron Horse Brewery that opened its doors in December of 2004 was a bit different than today. It had a very mom and pop feel, and featured a look that was as traditional as it gets. The likely response:    "Yeah, I think some dude makes that in his basement or something..."    The word just wasn't getting out, and things didn't look good for the tiny brewery that made exceptionally tasty ales.   Well, a couple of hoodlums in their late-twenties jumped on the opportunity to own and operate their own brewery, and what resulted is the Iron Horse Brewery you know and love today. They tweaked some recipes, changed some names, threw some ridiculous theme parties to encourage locals to actually see the brewery with their own eyes, and good things started to happen. Locals started to dig what the guys were doing. A few bars took a chance and put Iron Horse back on tap, and the beer started flowing.     The word started getting out.

name: Island Brewing Company
description: Island Brewing Company has been brewing in Carpinteria, CA since July, 2000 and has steadily gained a following of enthusiasts along the Santa Barbara coast. Owner and brewer Paul Wright began his brewing adventures after receiving a homebrew kit for Christmas in 1991 in Novato, CA. He joined the local brew club and started winning awards for his beers. Soon he found himself president and heading up the Marin County State Fair competitions, and after burning out all the burners on the stove, he was banished to brewing outdoors. A certified beer judge, he worked at Marin Brewing Company before starting off on his own, moving south to Carpinteria. Now a family run brewery, Island Brewing Company has won awards on both the state and national level. We serve local bars, restaurants, and retail outlets and have five and fifteen-gallon kegs and 22-ounce bottles available for weddings, caterers, as well as for thirsty individuals that happen to come our way. We’ve now opened a new brewery in beautiful downtown Carpinteria and hope you’ll stop by to visit soon.

name: Itchen Valley Brewery
description: Founded in 1997 by two businessmen at the Christening of their Godson Dugald Rhodes. The Godfathers, pleased with their honorary responsibility, thought carefully for the future of little Dugald.    Several pints of mediocre ale later the idea for forming a brewery and making their own beer began to take hold. A toast was made and within weeks a site (wholly inadequate) was found and the equipment (too big for the site) was bought.    The first brew, Godfathers, won the Bronze Award for best ale in Britain the following year at the Great British Beer Festival.    16 years, 30 million pints and a brewery relocation later IVB continues to thrive. Situated in the heart of Hampshire we produce an unrivalled range of award winning real ales with pure Hampshire water, yeast and barley along with the finest hops around the country and world.    Godson Dugald is as yet too young to enjoy his beer birthright, but we’re sure he will.

name: Ithaca Beer Co.

We strive to make this company better and build our brand name and good reputation among our customers.    Over the last decade we have worked hard doing just that, and we have had lots of fun in the process!  From our friendly staff to the award-winning beer to our community outreach, Ithaca Beer continues to brew beers for the purpose of making your simple moments worthwhile.  Take a moment to look around our brand new site and learn about more about Ithaca Beer as a company, the beers we brew, and our involvement in Ithaca, NY.

description: The Ivory Tower Brewery - where it's all academic!    We are proud to be partnered with Academic Affairs and be the home of the brewing class here at Appalachian State University. Headed up by Dr. Brett Taubman and Dr. Shea Tuberty this class provides a rigorous coverage of the chemical, biological, and physical processes that go into brewing malted beverages, including coverage of the hops, malt, and yeast varieties and how they are combined to produce specific styles and flavors of beers. The class also covers the history of fermented beverages as well as the business side of beer and brewing. Students enjoy a "hands on-minds on" approach to brewing basic styles of beer during class at the Ivory Tower Educational Brewery in the Broyhill Events Center.

description: Established in 1997, J.J. Bitting Brewing Company was the first brewery to operate in Woodbridge Township, New Jersey, since the repeal of prohibition in 1933. Our spacious 3 story restaurant resides in a beautifully restored 100 year old brick building that once housed The J.J. Bitting Coal and Feed Depot. name: Jack Pine Brewery - Taproom
description: Most homebrewers, at some point, begin to dream of starting their own brewery.  I had always liked my beer, but I realized that there tends to be a brewer’s bias towards their own beer.  A great deal of time and effort goes into making a batch of beer, so the brewer is bound to speak highly of their own goods.  It turns out, I’m my own worst critic.  I’m constantly searching for ways to improve the beer.  Whenever I shared brews with others, they always liked it as well, but who doesn’t like free beer?  For me, the seed was planted quite a few years ago when I started winning homebrewing awards statewide.  It was then I began to realize that I was making more than just pretty good homebrew.  I was making some damn good beer!  I began volunteering to judge at homebrew competitions and making an effort to get out and sample more of the beers not available in northern Minnesota.  I quickly realized that there was much more to explore in the world of beer than I realized.  I studied and tasted everything I could find regarding brewing science and beer styles.  In the midst of all of the studying and research, I took the Beer Judge Certification Program test and obtained a National rank in the BJCP.  I now had some credentials to back up my knowledge of good beer and brewing.  It was clear that this was starting to become more than just a hobby, so I began to put a bit more time and effort into the dream of starting a brewery.    So, after all this research and planning, what’s the plan?  Start small.    Jack Pine Brewery is starting very small.  Nanobrewery small.  Brewing forty gallons at a time small.  Did I mention the brewer is small?    This little brewery serves as a pilot system for the eventual build-out of a full scale production brewery.  It provides the opportunity to test the waters before sinking a boatload of cash into a warehouse full of stainless equipment.  Best of all, it gives YOU a chance to TRY THE BEER!  I’ve been my own worst critic for the past 12 years of homebrewing.  Now it’s your turn.  With your help, we can build a brewery to provide our friends and neighbors with delicious locally-brewed beer.    So, stop in and give it a try!

Jack's Abby Brewing
description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

name: Main Cidery
description: Jack’s Hard Cider is produced and canned by Hauser Estate Winery just 8 miles west of Historic Gettysburg, Pa. Our cider is produced from apples native to our home, Adams County Pennsylvania.  Featuring our farm fresh flavor, never from concentrate, Jack’s Hard Cider is part of the growing craft cider revolution.    The partially solar-powered, completely under-ground, naturally cool (55 degree) winery & cidery, churns out thousands of gallons of Jack’s Hard Cider per year. Each batch starts as apples skillfully grown and tended to by our farm manager Lee Wagner. Their juice is then carefully crafted by our Cider-maker and is filtered slowly to maintain flavor and a high level of smoothness for which our product has been noted. Jack’s Hard Cider awaits maturity in state of the art stainless steel tanks, and finally is canned on-site.

name: Jackalope Brewing Company
description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

description: Leinenkugel’s. The brand born in Wisconsin’s Northwoods 143 years ago, shares a powerful story of adventure, family and brewing heritage. A story of fifth generation craft brewers. And a portfolio of 11 distinctive, flavorful beers. No other brewer more passionately shares its family history or connects with its fans like Leinie’s.     The Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company produced its first beer in 1867 for the thirsty lumberjacks inhabiting Wisconsin’s Northwoods. Based in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin, the brand has continued in the rich European tradition of brewing crisp, refreshing, and delicious craft beers.

description: We are a production craft brewery located in Laurel Maryland. name: Jailhouse Brewing Company
description: Some often tell me that the old Hampton Jailhouse was the overnight home to many a drunken guest through the years. It seems only fitting that beer is being brewed in this quaint little two-story brick structure built in the 1920's. It's had its history as the jail, fire station, courthouse, mason lodge, and last but not least a sandwich shop that made those little sandwiches you can buy in gas stations. You know the triangle packaged ones that have mystery meat in them? Don't lie, you've had one. Today it is home to JailHouse Brewing Company and we are brewing hand-crafted beer not punching out license plates.

name: Jaipur Restaurant and Brewpub
description: We are a two barrel (64 gallon) brewery located within the restaurant. All of the brewing process takes place right here! Our beers are created to compliment the cuisine. The beer we serve is fresh because it is made with all natural ingredients. Malted barley is added to water and boiled for nearly an hour. Fresh hops are added throughout the boil to add both flavor and aroma. This un-fermented beer is called wort and is pumped from the boil room to one of the three fomenters we have in the restaurant.

name: James River Brewing Company
description: The James River Brewing Company grew organically from a simple weekend experiment. It started with the age-old temptation to harness the process of fermentation and concoct our own ideas and flavors. Our first try intrigued us so much that we had to try again and this time share it with our friends and neighbors. We then realized that this could be more than a pastime, but a part of our small, local community. The only way we would do it is if we could make more than just a beer, but a revival.

name: Jamesport Brewing Company
description: Jamesport Center is a late Victorian six storefront complex. The earliest section was completed in 1890 and was occupied by the Red Andrews Saloon and the Central House Hotel. It was built by August Tiedemann, a noted local builder and architect, for two Swedish brothers, "Red" Andrew Johnson and Axel Johnson. It largely served sailors of the Great Lakes during the booming days of logging in Western Michigan.  In 1892 a second structure with decorative cast iron columns was added.(Now, entrance to Sunset Bay Antiques.) It served as the lobby of the Central House Hotel and provided a dining room, upstairs parlor rooms and additional bedrooms.  In 1905 the final four storefronts were added to provide apartments for the employees of the recently completed Star Watch Case Co., then located on nearby Rath Street. The ground level store-fronts of the buildings have been used for a wide variety of trades over the past 120 plus years, including a butcher shop, a millinery, a theatorium, a dry cleaners, a hardware store, a clothing shop, various furniture stores, the State Liquor Control Commission store, a bicycle shop, the local headquarters for the National Maritime Union, and currently, Sunset Bay Antiques and Jamesport Brewing Company

name: Jasper Murdock's Alehouse / The Norwich Inn
description: In 1993, this Vermont brewery tradition was revived at the Norwich Inn when Jasper Murdock's Alehouse began producing traditional English-style ales in 5-gallon glass jugs. By 1995, an historic livery building was renovated and outfitted with a new four-barrel brew house, enabling 125-gallon batches. Though the vessels are now larger, we remain one of the smallest breweries in America.

name: Jasper Ridge Brewery
description: Established in 1996, the Jasper Ridge Brewery produces  beer made from all natural ingredients such as malts, hops, yeast, and water and creates beer that is bursting with individual flavor, color, and aroma. We provide it to you fresh from our 10-barrel all-grain brewing system on our property. We've rediscovered the rich, enjoyable flavor of fresh brewed beer.

name: Jaxons Restaurant and Brewing Co
description: Established in 1973, Jaxon's Restaurants & Brewing Co. has been providing the very best Southwestern food for over 30 years. Jaxon’s specialties include signature homemade Potato Green Chili and Tortilla soups, Santa Barbara Beef, a specially seasoned grilled sirloin served sliced with Jaxon’s own barbeque sauce; unique appetizers, fresh salads, gourmet hamburgers, hand-cut steaks, and much more! Jaxon’s “King” Margaritas and signature cocktails are acclaimed as the best in the region. Jaxon’s Brewery, the fourth oldest brew pub in the state of Texas, pours a variety of award-winning handcrafted ales and lagers. In addition, Jaxon’s offers FREE wireless Internet access and a wide range of multimedia services for business meetings and special events.

name: Jester King Craft Brewery
description: Located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country, Jester King Craft Brewery is an authentic farmhouse brewery committed to brewing artisan ales of great depth and character. At times drawing influences from the world beyond traditional brewers’ yeast, Jester King’s beer is not rushed to market but allowed to mature – often in oak barrels – to create the most enjoyable, interesting and exciting beer we can make. An additional layer of complexity is added to Jester King’s bottled beers by allowing a second fermentation to take place in the bottle. As part of its commitment to sustainability, the slow food movement and Texas, Jester King beer uses as many organic and local ingredients as possible and will soon be brewed with harvested rainwater.

name: John A. Huber Brewing Company
description: The John A Huber Brewing Company is a family owned and operated business. Here, brewing is family    "The concept for John A. Huber Brewing Company was set in motion in 1984 with the dreams of Missouri farmboy John Huber as he tasted his first home-brewed beer. In 2003, John received a home-brew kit for Christmas from his wife and sons. It was at that moment the Huber Brew or "Hubrew", the Company's flagship beer, was born. In 2009, he opened up Homebrew Supply of Southeast Missouri, LLC in Jackson, Missouri. In 2011, the John A. Huber Brewing Company took root in Fruitland, Missouri. The Company is a family owned and operated business. John's sons, Matthew and Chad, assist their father in the Company's operation. John and his family have lived in Southeast Missouri all their lives. They want to share their passion for brewing, their sense of community and their comradery. Come join them." name: John Smith's Brewery
description: Founded in 1758 and originally known as the Backhouse & Hartley Brewery, John Smith's Brewery traces it's roots back to Tadcaster, Yorkshire, England. The company is famous for it's Bitter and Extra Smooth Ales, which have been amongst Britain's best selling ales since the 1990s.

name: Jungle Beer
description: Jungle Beer was conceived by a group of friends with a passion for premium craft beer and all the other finer things in life. It is absurd to us that in tropical Asia the food have the most sophisticated flavours yet all that is usually expected from the beer is “refreshing,” “crisp,” and “cool.” That is what water is for – beer can be so much more!     We therefore set out to create beers that embody the spirit of Singapore and the tropics - rich, vibrant, adventurous and full of character; beers that are as diverse and exciting as our cuisine; beers that don't just quench your thirst and wash down food but enrich the experience make you relish the moment.     Unplug from the boring and ordinary – Welcome to the Jungle!

name: Junkyard Brewing Company
description: Junkyard Brewing Company was conceived as I brewed my first batch of homebrew in college. I still remember that batch; it was a five-gallon recipe with eight pounds of dark malt extract powder and eight ounces of chinook hops for the boil with a packet of dry yeast to ferment it. I "bottled" this first batch in pint-sized canning jars and judged when the natural carbonation had taken place by the "plink, plink" noises of the lids buckling upward under pressure. Friends suggested names for my first brew, and a couple stand out in my mind: "Junk's Trunk" and "Junkyard" beer. It was  nicknames like these that helped guide me toward choosing the name "Junkyard" for our brewing company when the time came to  attach a name to my idea.

description: Jupiter is the East Bay's most popular beerhouse, locally owned & operated, serving its own handcrafted beers & ales along with wood-fired pizzas. Housed in an old livery stable from the 1890's, Jupiter exudes a European atmosphere found in the heart of Berkeley, California. (The design was inspired by the oldest bar in Berlin.)

name: Jurnee Brews
description: Jurnee Brewing Company (JBC) is a craft brewing partnership founded in 2010. Jurnee Brews has locations in Centreville, Virginia and Ewing, New Jersey.  This microbrewery is a collaboration of two men who themselves are on an exceptional journey to bring what was once an idea to your local watering hole. Jurnee is more than what is in the bottle, it's about how it came together...the journey. Just like in life, we have experiences throughout time that form who we are as people, it just so happens our journey culminates in a bottle.

name: Justice Brewing
description: Established as Justice Brewing, LLC in 2009 I set out to open a small scale craft brewery. Having spent a few years as a homebrewer and always wanting to work for myself I attended Craft Brewing classes at Chemeketa Community College in Salem, OR and read as many books as I could on brewing. I searched for a long time trying to find a suitable place to open up and could be licensed as a Microbrewery. I finally found the location in 2011 and started the move. Then finally in 2012 went through all the legal red tape of opening Everett’s first Belgian Style brewery.    Due to current regulations in the City of Everett we are not open for retail sales. You can make an appointment if you would like a tour or make arrangements for a delivery.    Among other things we now brew AWARD WINNING BEER! Thats right our recipes are now the recipients of not only numerous Blue & Red Ribbons at the 2012 Evergreen State Fair but our “White & Nerdy” Belgian Wit won Best of Show.

name: Kalnapilis Brewery
description: Kalnapilis is a Lithuanian brewery, established by Albert Foight in Panev?žys in 1902. A landowner of German origin, Foight named the brewery "Bergschlösschen", meaning a small castle on the hill. In 1918, the name was changed to a Lithuanian equivalent of Bergschlösschen, Kalnapilis.    Kalnapilis was taken over by Baltic Beverages Holding (established by Pripps of Sweden and Hartwall of Finland) in 1994. Ownership passed to Royal Unibrew in 2001, which merged the Kalnapilis with Tauras brewery in Vilnius into AB Kalnapilio-Tauro Grup?.    In April 1996, new fermentation and storage equipment enabled significantly different processing, the result being the introduction of three new brands. The brewery has an annual maximum capacity of 600,000 hectolitres.    Kalnapilis won 2 gold awards at the 2004 World Beer Cup, the Olympics of beer competitions; one in the German Style Heller Bock or Maibock category, for 'Kalnapilis 7.3', and one in the Muenchener style Helles category, for 'Kalnapilis Original'.    The brand has a significant presence in sports advertising, and promotes a sporty image.

name: Kalona Brewing Company
description: We, at Kalona Brewing Company, are passionate for quality, are uniquely offbeat-but substantial, creative, warm and inclusive.     We believe you will find that reflected in both the products we brew and in the restaurant atmosphere we create for your dining and drinking enjoyment.   One of our goals is to be Kalona’s living room – a place where people can come to relax, relate, and have some recreation playing scrabble or dominos by the fireplace in the sofa area of the restaurant. Plus we have a fantastic beer garden to enjoy during the warmer weather.    Kalona Brewing Company and Eatery is strategically located in beautiful downtown Kalona at 405 B Avenue, a half hour drive south from Iowa City.    The brewery is home to a fifteen barrel brewing system from Newlands Systems Inc., which includes a three vessel brew house, four 15bbl fermenters, two 30bbl fermenters and two 15bbl bright tanks.

name: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In
description: We’ve been retailing here since 1986, the Topiwala family with mom and pop and three brothers as well as the help of a handful of invaluable staff members. Pop started in the recession years of Reaganomics, thru the boom of Clintonia and still strong despite George II & the current class wars. Starting as a convenience store & gas station, we’ve been evolving from pretty much day one, trying to offer quality and service like our friendly Travis Heights neighbors and fellow Austinites deserve.    We are committed to sustainable, local, and organic & natural produce and groceries with our offerings on the shelf as well as our kitchen menu (No high fructose corn syrup or MSG!!!) With 72 taps of beer available, we are quite picky on what we present with only quality brews that go with our food.    We also enjoy giving back to the community with nonprofit fundraisers and support for grassroots organizations.    We serve our very own authentic and unique Gujarati-style Indian food, mom approved.    Beer by the pint & wine by the glass make it that much more of a yummy pairing.    Our own brews are specifically designed for our menu items!    Also enjoy live music in our unique intimate and awesome music room, or at least our staff selections of eclectic tunes.

All of our handcrafted beers will be unfiltered and brewed locally in our custom built two-vessel brew house located in Ocean in Monmouth County. Our beers will be self-distributed and available on draft at restaurants and bars in coastal and northern New Jersey. We plan to launch in the spring of 2011.

name: Kannah Creek Brewing Company
description: Our journey began in 2005 in Grand Junction, Colorado, when we opened a small brewpub Kannah Creek Brewing Company.  During the first seven years of brewing our focus was always on quality as we developed seven traditional beer styles and multiple seasonal and specialty beers.  With several awards to our name and a growing demand for our beer, we took a huge leap and expanded into a brand new 12,000 square foot 30 barrel production facility in the south downtown area of Grand Junction near the Colorado River.  This new restaurant that also houses our production facility is known as Edgewater Brewery.    Throughout our growth we have invested our time, energy, and resources reflecting our passion and devotion to maintain the highest standard quality.  We currently bottle three of our mainstays in additional to seasonal selections.  Plus limited release bomber bottles of a select variety. description: Located in downtown Port Allen, “The Worlds Westernmost Brewery” and Kauai’s only brewpub, Kauai Island Brewery & Grill is open for business and eager to serve the Island of Kauai’s craft beer drinkers!    Kauai Island Brewing Company (KIBC) has its origins in Waimea Brewing Company, which had been located on the historic Waimea Plantations. When the lease was up, owners Bret and Janice Larson, along with their brewmaster Dave Curry and his wife Christina, decided to come together and become co-owners of their newly created Kauai Island Brewing Company, moving locations to Port Allen where they would have more space to brew the delicious beers they were known for.     After eight months of renovation, Kauai Island Brewing Company has its home in the industrial building complex of Port Allen Center, with an industrial theme to go along with both its surroundings and purpose of crafting quality beers. Its 35-foot high corrugated metal ceilings and walls give it an open and spacious feel. The retro atmosphere with chandelier lights hanging from the ceiling, a catwalk leading to the second story mezzanine over the entrance, and picture perfect views of the sunset over Port Allen bay from the second story window makes it hard to say goodbye to this beautiful place.    We offer up to 10 of our own handcrafted in-house beers as well as several guest microbrewed beers, all on draft. If you can't stay for a pint, that's okay! We sell 64-ounce growlers that you can fill and take with you, as well as kegs available for customer pickup.

name: Kawrtha Lakes Brewing Company
description: A fine and successful Ontario microbrewery, Kawartha Lakes has been producing tasty beers for almost four years. Beginning in 1996 with their now-famous Raspberry Wheat Ale and Pale Ale as draught-only selections in Ontario pubs, the brewery developed a strong following with beer connoisseurs.    The brewery added Nut Brown Ale and Cream Ale to their slate, and offered their ales in oversize 473mL bottles for sale at only at the brewery. This led to many beer pilgrimages by this writer to Peterborough to satisfy my thirst.    Luckily, Kawartha Lakes now distributes their Raspberry Wheat and Cream Ale in 12-packs in a growing number of Beer Stores. Due to the immense popularity of KLB beers, their Nut Brown Ale will also be available in Beer Stores beginning in September. Drinkers who desire their fine Pale Ale must still trek up to Central Ontario, but hopefully this brew will follow sometime in the future and round out their slate.    Kawartha Lakes was recently written up in the National Post, with the headline on March 8 reading: "The last thing thriving Kawartha Lakes Brewing needs is more customers". It is great to see an Ontario microbrewery succeeding, which has been something of a rarity in this province's microbrewery industry over the last few years.

After months of cleaning and rebuilding, Keegan Ales brewed its first batch of beers on August 1, 2003(Tommy’s mom’s birthday) and set out hand-selling beer to local bars and restaurants early September. The first kegs of Old Capital, Hurricane Kitty and Mother’s Milk went to competition at Hunter Mountain that month. Mother’s Milk took home a gold medal and Old Capital was honored with People’s Choice: Best of Show.    After getting the brewery up and running selling draft beer, the crew at Keegan Ales turned their attention to the defunct bottling line. It had been left broken and literally in hundreds of pieces. It took months of pounding, tinkering and countless scratching of heads, but by the summer of 2004, Keegan Ales was available in 12 ounce bottles!

name: Kettlehouse Brewing Company
description: It’s 1991. Tim O’Leary, a third generation Montanan was living in Colorado, finding his way working for NOAA, mountain biking and skiing… and feeling a little bit like a fish out of water. Colorado is a beautiful state, but Montana was home. One afternoon on his bike ride home, he spotted a new business that had cropped up in Boulder. It was a Brew on Premise (BOP) – a place where customers could come in and brew their own beer. Having dabbled in homebrewing for a few years, he tried it and thought, “This is my ticket back home.”    Fast forward to 1995. Tim and his wife, Suzy Rizza, open Missoula’s first BOP. Lots of people came to try it, and lots of people had a great time doing it. name: Kiuchi Brewery
description: The beginning The Kiuchi Brewery was established in 1823 by Kiuchi Gihei, the headman of Kounosu village. His family was collecting rice from farmers as land taxes for the Mito Tokugawa family. He began his brewery with the idea of using the remaining rice stocks in the warehouse. At this time in Japan a new political movement began to reform the Tokugawa regime. Fujita Toko, one of the movement's activists, advocated an ideology to build a new organizational government with a reverence of the emperor, and his thought led to the Meiji Restoration.    Fujita was a close friend of Kiuchi, who named one of his sakes "KIKUSAKARI" as a respect to the emperor. KIKU (chrysanthemum) is a crest of the imperial household, and SAKARI means 'property'.    1950's Mikio Kiuchi inherited the brewery legacy in 1950. It was the time when the sake industry flourished as the rapid growth of Japan's economy after the World War II. Although many sake breweries started mass producing low quality sake due to increased demand, Kiuchi Brewery maintained their policy of pursuing the best quality of sake with the optimum ingredients and craftsman-ship.    Hitachino Beer In autumn 1996, Kiuchi started beer brewing business, named the brand "HITACHINO NEST BEER" with unique owl character logo.  Over the years, Kiuchi Brewery has gained Japan and worldwide attention by winning awards at numerous world beer competitions.  In 2000, Brew on Premises facilities has opened to introduce the Lager is the main stream in the beer industries in Japan.    Shochu Kiuchi Kiuchi built a Distillation facility in March, 2003. to aid with recycling and reduction of waste, beginning with the production of "Shochu Kiuchi" Distilled liquor made from Sakekasu (Sake lees) which is the by-product of Sake Brewing.    The wine brewing project is the latest challenge of Kiuchi Brewery. Kiuchi bought 4000 square meters of land next to the brewery for the vineyard. The grape seedlings, Merlot and Chardoney were imported from France. The vineyard produced its first crop in 2000.    In 2004, 3 tonnes of grapes were harvested producing 2000 Litres of Wine. This wine is hoped to be able to offer on a market as another prestigious Kiuchi brand in the near future...
